definition: artificial/man-made/having human cause or origin/human attempt or effort
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
the matter depends on the individual (idiom); it is a matter for your own effort/With effort, one can achieve anything.
lit. to be the meat on sb's chopping block (idiom)/fig. to be at sb's mercy
pinyin: ren2 wei2 dao1 zu3 , wo3 wei2 yu2 rou4

definition: lit. human beings will die for riches, just as birds will for food (idiom)/fig. man will do anything in his means to become rich
pinyin: ren2 wei4 cai2 si3 , niao3 wei4 shi2 wang2
zhu4 ren2 wei2 kuai4 le4 zhi1 ben3

sentences.english: Americans continue to debate how to interpret the Second Amendment.
sentences.chinese: 美国人为如何解释第二修正案继续辩论。

sentences.english: During Hellenistic times, Greek women also started to artificially wave and curl their hair.
sentences.chinese: 在希腊化时代期间，希腊女人就已开始人为地卷发了。

sentences.english: Try living for a week in an "other centered" universe.
sentences.chinese: 尝试着一个星期生活在一个以“他人为中心”的世界。

sentences.english: We must appoint a new teacher soon.
sentences.chinese: 作为一位总经理，他应当任人为贤。

sentences.english: Moral criteria are nature, the Tao, artificiality and manner.
sentences.chinese: 自然，道，人为，礼仪等道德标准。

sentences.english: The proud have hid a snare for me, and cords; they have spread a net by the wayside; they have set gins for me.
sentences.chinese: 骄傲人为我暗设网罗和绳索。

sentences.english: Like the SDGs themselves, cooperatives are people-centred.
sentences.chinese: 合作社与可持续发展目标一样，也是以人为本。

sentences.english: What do you think the mother duck is thinking?
sentences.chinese: 你人为这母鸭在想什么？

sentences.english: God often calls surrendered people to do battle on his behalf.
sentences.chinese: 神常常呼召向他委身的人为他打仗。

sentences.english: The company emphasizes humanist, Customer-friendliness and first service forever.
sentences.chinese: 公司强调以人为本，以客为尊，服务永远第一。

sentences.english: At the same time, implementation of people-centered concept of curriculum leadership to achieve this requirement exactly.
sentences.chinese: 以人为本的课程领导理念恰恰体现了这一要求。

sentences.english: When young and frivolous feel there is nothing, there will be efforts to results.
sentences.chinese: 年少轻狂的时候觉得事在人为，努力就一定会有结果。

sentences.english: Modern nursing people-oriented, emphasis on patient-centered.
sentences.chinese: 现代护理以人为本，强调以病人为中心。

sentences.english: A hypnotist looks for subjects who are easily entranced .
sentences.chinese: 找一些易受催眠的人为对象。

sentences.english: Rearing by imprinted birds with a certain amount of human contact.
sentences.chinese: 通过保持一定量的人为接触去饲养带铭印的鸟。

sentences.english: So the Levites made preparations for themselves and for the Aaronic priests.
sentences.chinese: 所以利未人为自己和祭司亚伦的子孙，预备祭物。

definition: (after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
therefore/as a result/thus/and as a result, ...
to maintain (that sth is true)/to determine (a fact)/determination (of an amount)/of the firm opinion/to believe firmly/to set one's mind on/to identify with
